docs.lead_paragraph: 10:59 p.m. | Wrapup With all this broken china on the floor, it's hard to know where to start picking up the pieces. Mrs. Clinton and Mr. Obama showed themselves pretty adept at hurling plates, then reaching into the cabinet and pulling out cups and saucers too.

headline.main: An Urgent Call for Mentors Who Are Men
headline.print_headline: An Urgent Call for Mentors Who Are Men

headline.seo: Freakonomics - Stephen J. Dubner - Steven D. Levitt - Red-Cockaded Woodpecker - Endangered Species

byline.original: By STEPHEN J. DUBNER and STEVEN D. LEVITT

docs.lead_paragraph: MAUKE--William W., 86, died Wednesday, January 16, 2008 at St. Joseph of The Pines Health Center in Southern Pines, North Carolina. He leaves his wife of 57 years, Elizabeth (Cahill) Mauke, a son, William II and his wife Heather (Caswell) Mauke of W. Simsbury, CT, four grandsons, William III, Christopher, Tucker and Colby, three sisters, Mary Mollicone of Newport Richey, FL, Jane Kelleher of Ormond Beach, FL, and Eleanor Caffrey of Worcester, MA. A sister, Gertrude, predeceased him. He was born in Worcester, MA son of William Alfred and Mary (McClosky) Mauke. Mr. Mauke graduated from the University of Iowa and was an officer in the U.S. Coast Guard. He was the Executive Vice-President of Guardian Life Insurance Co. in New York City before retiring in 1986. He served Guardian for over 30 years and was instrumental in building the company's employee benefit operation. Mr. Mauke lived in Upper Montclair, NJ for many years before retiring to Pinehurst, NC where he lived for the past 18 years. He was an avid tennis player, world traveler and devoted husband and father. A Memorial Service will be held at 11am on Tuesday, January 22, 2008 at Belle Meade, 100 Waters Dr., Southern Pines, NC. Donations may be made in his memory to the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research, Tribute Gifts, Church St., P.O. Box 780, New York, NY 10008-0780 or online at www.michaeljfox.org.
